content.description:
A 3 pitch route up the center open book of the Granite Buttress, with good variations on 2 and 3.

The 2nd pitch; Willy’s Corner, 5.6 and especially pitch 3; Willy’s Roof 5.10a with 5.10b finger crack variation are mini trad classics.

Willy’s Wally pitch 2 has a “sport” pitch 10m left of Instuctor of the Future. A flat wall from the top of a small pedestal, face climb carefully on hard to spot holds and a difficult to clip bolt 5.10c.

Large terraces and ledge separate pitches.
content.location: Center, Granite Buttress south Face. The Snaz of Sinks Canyon. Hard to miss, easy to skip pitch 1.

content.description: right facing corner on the left end of the third tier
content.protection: bolted but can be done on gear

content.description: Climb a crack in the middle of the right face of Willie's Corner climb a small roof, then straight up or left.
content.protection: small to medium gear, One bolt at the top where the placements get sparse. bolted anchor at top.

content.description: Climb right face of a rounded arete in the middle of the cliff. 50 feet
content.location: Just right of willie's Corner. 2nd tier

content.description:
Right facing Crack on the left side of the 2nd tier. Sits just left of a black diagonal dike.

Beta:

Small roof that you skip by lunging to the right of it to a jug. Difficult move, but fun for tall people.
content.protection: Small to medium gear. one bolt at top, as well as bolts at the top of the climb

content.description: Just right of Sportsline is Dike and Vein, a sport climb on small features. Climb carefully to high 1st bolt. Encounter a “rocker block” a wobbly but secure? pinnacle, from standing on top, lie back, crimp, paste, and work big slopers to a finish with an burly, granite mantel. (Or traverse to Sportsline 5.12a)
content.location: 3m right of Sportsline and 8m left of Willy’s Wall, are a line of hard to see bolts. Granite Buttress upper tier left, an excellent way to summit.
